publicDescription:
Job Brief:

We at Al Tayer are looking for a Personnel Executive to manage the personnel services, ensuring the smooth functioning and satisfactory service provided to employees in the areas of payroll, administration, insurance and visas.

The role would involve follow up with the GR Officer on all related issues in Qatar, advise employees and line managers on all visa related issues, Oversee the employees‘(and their dependents where applicable) enrollment and cancellation of Visas, Advise and guide management on all procedural/ legal obligations to be followed in case of on boarding/off boarding employees, Process all letters request from the employees, Coordinate With Business Unit HR to facilitate HR Support in Qatar, Oversee administrative support to handle issues with Banks.

Oversee the provision of correspondence and documentation support on all employee related issues, ensure the maintenance of up-to-date personnel records/ files, Coordinate the issuance and cancellation of Inner circle, parking and access cards to employees.

Person Specification::

As a Personnel Executive, you shall have a Bachelors Degree in any specialization and at least 4 - 6 years work experience of administrative / personnel services in Qatar. Knowledge of written and spoken Arabic is essential.

You shall be a self motivated, assertive and driven individual having knowledge of MS Office and MS Projects (or equivalent software) excellent communication skills bringing along high analytical ability with a good eye for detail, with good organization and team playing skills . You would be an excellent communicator having dealt with internal and external stakeholders.
title: Personnel Executive

publicDescription:
IT Project Manager

About the Job

Leading technical organisation with offices located close to Redhill, Surrey seeks an IT Project Manager

The Role

IT Project Manager, responsible for the management, performance and completion of single or multiple projects up to £5M.

Main duties to include:

· Serving as the primary contact for the customer.

· To review the technical approach, feasibility and cost estimates for projects.

· To conduct project coordination meetings and present projects to senior management.

· Manage commercial provisions with customer, alongside contracts administrator.

publicDescription:
Project Manager

About the Job

Leading technical organisation with offices located close to Redhill, Surrey seeks an IT Project Manager

The Role

IT Project Manager, responsible for the management, performance and completion of single or multiple projects up to £5M.

Main duties to include:

· Direct projects involving extensive IT Infrastructure and some aspects of software engineering development

· Serving as the primary contact for the customer.

· To manage, oversee, monitor and approve all elements of assigned projects from inception to completion, including proposal development, product design, procurement, subcontracting, testing, delivery, installation and acceptance of solutions.

· To review the technical approach, feasibility and cost estimates for projects.

· To plan and direct the integration of project team members representing various functional areas within the company.

· To conduct project coordination meetings and present projects to senior management.

· To plan and manage resource availability for projects such as engineering, manpower, production, computer support or installation facilities.

· Manage commercial provisions with customer, alongside contracts administrator.

· Responsible to complete each project in accordance with Quality processes, procedures and within the financial
title: Project Manager

publicDescription:
We are seeking qualified and experienced personnel to work as part of the Vale Project team in a range
of areas including services to the Project Commissioning team to facilitate execution of the projects
commissioning plan.
The Vale Commissioning group is responsible for: pre-commissioning (S2) tasks required to verify
equipment / component integrity; and, cold commissioning (S3) tasks required to verify logic and
controls will function as designed. The newly constructed process systems have been divided into
commissionable sub-systems consisting on mechanical equipment, piping and electrical power &
controls. Sub-systems are logically grouped and assigned to one of four Commissioning groups. . An S3
Commissioning Group consists of Area Lead(s), Team Leads, Pre-Commissioning Technicians,
Commissioning Technical Support, Vale Foreman, Vale Control Room Technicians and Vale Technicians.
Each group is supplemented with a construction team, a controls team and an electrical team dedicated
to the Commissioning group.
The position of Commissioning Area Lead provides the leadership to one of the commissioning groups
responsible for S3 commissioning tasks. The position will be a direct report to the Commissioning
Manager who is responsible for overall commissioning plan.
The successful candidate will be responsible for Day to day duties and deliverables as follows:
• Responsible for implementation on a day to day basis of a strong health and safety culture in
line with Vale’s Safety and Health and Environment management system.
• Responsible for the management of an assigned commissioning group work on site.
• Ensures the commissioning set-up, including of pre-testing and vendor assistance, and process
commissioning is efficiently executed to satisfy of commissioning objectives.
• Provide direction and support to the group’s Team Leads so they can plan for the execution of
Commissioning activities week(s) in advance.
• Ensure completion of check sheets and related paperwork that facilitates turnover of a subsystem to the operating group is completed.
• Report weekly into database program to report on commissioning progress and bottlenecks on a
sub-system level.
• Assist in mitigation plans to overcome any schedule slippages resulting in identified
commissioning shortfalls.
• Participate in weekly schedule meetings to modify the Primavera schedule so it accurately
reflects the planned turnover date and tracks commissioning progress.
• Monitor completion of outstanding construction and commissioning punches and turnover
readiness.
title: Large and in chargee

publicDescription:
VACANCY POSTING

 

Chevron Exploration and Production Netherlands B.V.

 

 

 

Position Title:                        Fiscal Metering Specialist

 

Work Location:                     CEPN - Voorburg Office

 

Date Required:                      As soon as possible

 

Supervisor:                            Facility Engineering Team Leader

                                                           

 

Key job responsibilities: 

Subject matter expert (SME) for gas and liquid metering at all Chevron Exploration and Production Netherlands (CEPN) offshore installations. The metering SME is responsible for all aspects of gas and liquid metering and overall accountable for the quality and correctness of the fiscal measurements and production reporting.

 

Roles and responsibilities:

  • < >esponsible for the quality of calibration, auditing, verification and maintenance of all types meters, flow computers, and supervisory systems in use within CEPN , with support from the maintenance department;

    Engineering lead fordefining thespecificationforinstallationsandforwritingimplementinginstrumentcommissioningproceduresfrominitialdesignpackssupervises

  • Assist the production department in conflicts with productionallocationprocedures,systemsanddatabases;

  • Review and verifymonthlyvolumereportingand thecorrectionsmadeto thosevolumes;

  • Represent CEPN during metering audits;

  • < >

    Responsible toresolvingnon-routine problemsrelatedtometeringsystemsand equipment;

  • < >

    Assist the Facility engineer group in general metering opportunities;

 

Job requirements:

  • Mid level professional education in instrument engineering or Business (MBO/HBO-level);

  • Preferably ten years experience or more in the Oil and Gas Industry;

  • < >< >< >

    Able to interpret technical manuals and procedures;

 

Skills and Competencies:

  • Good communicate across the boundary of disciplines;

  • Accurate and detailed oriented;

  • Good communication skills in Dutch and English;

  • Proficient in use of all Micro Soft office software.

publicDescription:
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 

 

 

 

Stakeholder Manager

 

 

 

Job Description:

 

·    Develop and implement a stakeholder relationship management strategy to achieve the project objectives.

·    Work closely with the PM advice on and assist in the management of relationships with relevant authorities and department.

·    Oversee the efficient management of relationships with key sponsors, supporters and partners to ensure ongoing, mutually beneficial relationships and ongoing project.

·    Set up frameworks and procedures, and develop appropriate, timely communication approaches and support materials to enhance communications with key stakeholders.

·    Advise on the development and maintenance of frameworks to improve member relations, including regular consultations with members on issues, priorities and member service delivery.

·    Liaise closely with team members to provide timely advice to the PM about emerging issues, stakeholders’ satisfaction and to secure team members engagement.

·    Ensure that the project is managing the interface with stakeholders and the general public professionally.

·    Work closely with the client’s communications team to support the project

communications.

·    Monitor and report on performance on communications with stakeholders.

·    Manage and promote the adoption of consistent processes across the project team to achieve and maintain high standards of stakeholder communication.

·    Maintain a concise record of stakeholders’ issues.

title: Stake Holder Manager

title: VP Technical

publicDescription:
Training Developer, who is experienced in developing technical training for customers and employees for Energy Products. In this job you will also be responsible for creating individual work plans, meet day-to-day short-term objectives and resolve issues through immediate action or short-term planning. This job is location in the Downtown area of Houston and contract job for a 12 month project.

 

Job Description:

·  Responsible for developing training programs and /modules that align with and support business strategies; assess learning needs and measure effectiveness of training solutions

·  Develop company-wide instructional training material and communications based on support and enhancement of business strategy and needs assessment results

·  Work closely with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to create learning content and communications

·  Gather and understand information, products and services, policies, procedures, systems and skills requiring instruction or development

·  Develop high-level and detailed content outlines/storyboards to result in computer-based/delivered learning modules, including creating course content at a level appropriate to defined objectives and target audience within quality controlled standards while enhancing content through effective storytelling

·  Update and maintain published training material and communications

Qualifications:

·  Two to four years of professional training experience, or equivalent corporate- and plant-related training programs experience preferred

·  Exceptional Computer Skills, including a minimum of 4 years of experience and skill in using computer software - Adobe Acrobat Professional, Microsoft Office Suite

·  Demonstrate knowledge and utilization of adult learning methodology (ADDIE).

·  Experience developing customized training sessions and learning tools such as job aids, tests, etc. based on learner needs

·  Preferred e-learning development experience

·  Preferred experience with Articulate Suite

·  Excellent presentation and communication skills

·  Must be able to produce learning content quickly, according to established writing standards and sound instructional design principles

·  Ability to work in a collaborative team environment while still managing individual project content and production

·  Willingness to seek out and respond to feedback

·  Understand and respond to quickly changing priorities and business needs

·  Ability to execute with urgency in a very fast-paced environment

·  Strong attention to detail

·  High level of organizational skills

·  Strong internal and external customer service skills

·  Ability to manage multiple projects
title: Senior Trainer
